review: The initial set up was difficult as the left right/up down button on the remote would jump anywhere from 2-7 spaces at a time when trying to enter my wifi password and my Netflix password, and at times would stick and endlessly scroll until I hit another button.  It also lost connection to my wifi on the 2nd day, less than 36 hours after installing it, and I had to power cycle the unit on the back of my TV to get it to reconnect.  In that regard, it does not have as good of reception as the Chrome Stick, and has to be plugged into the wall to work properly, where as my Chrome Stick worked fine being powered by the USB adapter on my TV.  They need to improve the reception in future models and the power cord is only a few feet long so if you do not have an outlet very close to your TV, YOU WILL NEED AN EXTENSION CORD.  VERY ANNOYING.  MAKE IT LONGER.Overall, when working, which it has since then,  I am pretty happy with having my Netflix, HULU, HBOGO and Amazon PRIME and Amazon Music all on one streaming device with a remote to navigate.  The menus are also easy to see and Navigate.  It is worth the $39.00.Only 1 more issue.  Since I have a Prime Account, and I get free 2 day shipping, why did it take 10 days to fulfill the order and get it shipped?

review: As an Amazon stockholder (since '97), I really wish the Fire Stick was phenomenal. But I have to say - it's not even as good as Roku 1. The interface is complex. I paid only $20 as a Prime customer. And I don't think it's worth that. It did set itself up - one plus - but not a strong enough point to make me want to give a dozen to friends and family as gifts. Suggest you keep looking. Try Roku 2 or Roku 3 or one of the DVD players that pulls in Netflix and other streaming services. I would imagine the Roku stick is really good.
